newsitem.title: INDIA: India Crisil rating for three fixed deposits.
newsitem.headline: India Crisil rating for three fixed deposits.

text.p: The Credit Rating Information Services of India Ltd (CRISIL) announced its ratings for the following five non-convertible debentures, three fixed deposits and one commercial paper.
Company Instrument Rating Issue size(Rupees)/
Comment
* EPC Irrigation Ltd. NCD D (For 180 million)
(Downgraded from BBB)
* Gujarat Gas Financial Services Ltd. FD FA (Upgraded from FA-)
* Nestle India Ltd. NCD AAA (For 250 million)
* Rama Newsprint & Paper Ltd. NCD BB+ (For 540 million)
(Downgraded from BBB+)
* Suman Motels Ltd. FD FB (Downgraded from FA)
* Shaan Interwell (India) NCD BB (For 50 million)
(Downgraded from A-)
* Usha Beltron Ltd. NCD AA- (For 200 million)
(Downgraded from AA)
FD FAA-
CP P1 (For 80 million)

Note: AAA/FAAA indicates highest safety, AA/FAA high safety, A/FA adequate safety, BBB moderate safety, BB/FB inadequate safety and D default for the partly convertible debentures (PCD), non convertible debenture (NCD), optionally convertible debentures (OCD),fixed deposits (FD), floating yield bonds (FYB) and floating rate bonds (FRB) issues, auction rated note (ARN), Certificate of Deposit (CD), Secured Convertible Premium Notes (SCPN), Convertible Premium Notes (CPN), Floating Rate Note (FRN), Structured Obligation (so), Pass Through Certificates (PTC), Short Term Debt (STD), Non Convertible Bonds (NCB).
P1 indicates very strong, P2 strong and P3 adequate for commercial paper (CP) issues. SO means structured obligation.

Crisil may apply '+'(plus) or '-' signs for ratings from AA to C and FAA to FC to reflect comparative standing within the category, and '+' (plus) sign for ratings from P1 to P3 to reflect a comparatively higher standing within the category. CRISIL uses prefix of "pf" to its long term rating symbols for preference shares.
'F' is used as a prefix for Fixed Deposit ratings.
